reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Health Tanzania. Capacity building for health care sector in Tanzania

description.narrative: The developmental objective of the project is to continue to improve the impact of Tanzanian health services especially of maternal and infant health services and services for children with disabilities by training interventions. Health is a crucial determ inant of societal development. A specific aim is within the catchment area of selected regional hospitals to ascertain the availability of sufficient and relevant monitoring and health services before and during pregnancy and childbirth as well as postnata lly. These services are reinforced by strengthening practical skills via on the job learning and by developing health care education (further education and vocational education) in the region. Doctors midwives mothers public heath nurses and community heal th workers and students are supported to work as multiprofessional teams. It is especially important to strengthen the possibilities for rehabilitation of children with birth injuries and children with disability. Mentors and coaches are voluntary Finnish doctors with long experience of working in developing countries and lecturers and experts from university of applied sciences focusing on nursing public health and global health education. The whole health care system of Tanzania is the beneficiary via imp roved efficacy and quality and the personnel will take responsibility on health care provision in a holistic manner. The project aims at strengthening existing structures especially in rural neglected areas. This is expected to produce the highest added va lue.
